lexUnit.name: flounce.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: move in an exaggeratedly impatient or angry manner.

sentence.text: What with the jug of Red Snappers that Fielding had prepared , I was feeling no pain when the first candidate came flouncing across the floor .
She flounced into the bathroom , and then tried to think how to flounce out again in any way that would get her past his indispensable face and into the bloody lift .
Annie picked up her half-full coffee mug and flounced into the kitchen , suddenly at bay .
She flounces into the living room and holds open the door .
As she went to flounce past him , he checked her , saying again , ` Here !
She flounced past him , her arms full of table-coverings .
On the eve of the international , a Home Counties gourmet had flounced through a restaurant in St Germain to return his steak : ` Le service est terr-eeble ! " he cried .
But even in this , the red bitch was not to be counted on : fierceness and docility alternated as unpredictably as the direction of the winds that flounced through the valley in the early monsoon .
Er the erm er fact of the matter was that er er as has been recorded by those less emotionally charged at that moment , I did n't flounce out of the cabinet .
We 'd been bickering since New Year and she 'd flounced out of my city flat in early May , darkly muttering , Nevermore !
She flounced away from him , past Katherine and out of the room .
No need to say that Susan had flounced out of the house after declaring she was n't going to be there to welcome that woman .
And she flounced up to the house , her long black hair swinging rebelliously down her back from under her red woollen cap .
Dana flounced out of the room , confident she had everything arranged to her satisfaction .
-- and finished the scene , but by then the outraged governess had flounced out of the room .
Birkett flounced out of the room with his tins and his little pieces of wood .
She flounced out of the little shop , hoping he 'd follow her .
After Millie had flounced away to do her bidding , Aggie said , ` She came in that yard as white as a sheet .
and when I relent they flounce in
He flounced off , tugging at his hair .
The Swedish girl flounced off .
Fiona flounced off and a moment later Jean heard her going down the steps to her room in the basement .
And she flounces out .
And with that the Prince flounced out , all courtesy and good humour forgotten .
Zeinab rose from the table in a fury and flounced out .

This , of course , is very unfair : it is just not reasonable for me to flounce about in the bathroom for hours and then make a man feel inadequate when I catch him using my dental floss. or to bellow in disgust when I find out he blow-dries his hair .
Mary Mackie , 64 , of Walton-le-Dale , Lancs , said : ` It 's not right she should be flouncing around with her fancy man . "
An Anglican , meanwhile , accused those opposed to women priests of ` flouncing around like two-year-olds having tantrums in Tesco . "
Muttering to herself , she flounced back to the cats ' room and threw the kippers in .
Bessie nodded , glad for the chance of making her views known to the young mother , and she quickly flounced off out of the kitchen .
She rose and flounced off in a swish of skirts and a whiff of fragrant perfume .
She tossed her head and flounced briskly away .
And off she flounced .
